title: ICE: `DefId does not have a "def_span"`

labels.name: I-ICE
labels.description: Issue: The compiler panicked, giving an Internal Compilation Error (ICE) ❄️

labels.name: T-compiler
labels.description: Relevant to the compiler team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: requires-nightly
labels.description: This issue requires a nightly compiler in some way.

body:
### Code Not sure how this passes the test suite :upside_down_face: Original code from `./tests/ui/transmutability/issue-101739-2.rs` ```Rust #![crate_type = "lib"] #![feature(transmutability)] #![allow(dead_code, incomplete_features, non_camel_case_types)] mod assert { use std::mem::BikeshedIntrinsicFrom; pub fn is_transmutable< Src, Dst, Context, const ASSUME_ALIGNMENT: bool, const ASSUME_LIFETIMES: bool, const ASSUME_VALIDITY: bool, const ASSUME_VISIBILITY: bool, >() where Dst: BikeshedIntrinsicFrom< //~ ERROR trait takes at most 3 generic arguments but 6 generic arguments were supplied Src, Context, ASSUME_ALIGNMENT, ASSUME_LIFETIMES, ASSUME_VALIDITY, ASSUME_VISIBILITY, >, {} } fn via_const() { struct Context; #[repr(C)] struct Src; #[repr(C)] struct Dst; const FALSE: bool = false; assert::is_transmutable::(); } ```` reduced ```rust #![crate_type = "lib"] #![feature(transmutability)] mod assert { use std::mem::BikeshedIntrinsicFrom; pub fn is_transmutable< Src, Dst, Context, const ASSUME_ALIGNMENT: bool, const ASSUME_LIFETIMES: bool, >() where Dst: BikeshedIntrinsicFrom< Src, Context, (), (), >, {} } ``` ### Meta `rustc --version --verbose`: ``` rustc 1.70.0-nightly (87a2408b0 2023-04-11) binary: rustc commit-hash: 87a2408b06e7651f078a09f627940554da6137d5 commit-date: 2023-04-11 host: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu release: 1.70.0-nightly LLVM version: 16.0.2 ``` ### Error output ``` ```
Backtrace
